pr_title: Display latencies of the operations without the wait times.

timeline.bodyText:
Can you please remove Rate limited req/s from above and just call it Throughput? Also, do you have enough information to calculate throughput per transaction type? (similar to what you're doing for latencies below).
Let's also remove the rate limiting option from the config file - it's confusing for users.
timeline.author: ndeodhar
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -907,9 +906,35 @@ private static Results runWorkload(List<BenchmarkModule> benchList, boolean verb
         LOG.info("Num New Order transactions : " + numNewOrderTransactions + ", time seconds: " + time);

replies.bodyText: Another note: Can we use double for tpmc calculation instead of long and while printing, just use 2 digits after the decimal point?
replies.author: ndeodhar

timeline.bodyText: This will be a problem for long running workloads. Please add a TODO to fix this method of calculation.
timeline.author: ndeodhar

timeline.bodyText: Let's use milliseconds instead of microseconds.
timeline.author: ndeodhar
ndeodhar

timeline.bodyText: You'll need to change the header above too to only include Transaction Name, Latency (microseconds)
timeline.author: ndeodhar
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -171,14 +162,8 @@ public void writeAllCSVAbsoluteTiming(List<TransactionType> activeTXTypes, Print
         for (Sample s : latencySamples) {

timeline.bodyText: I think having start time might be good too. We could leave it there for now IMO.
timeline.author: ndeodhar

timeline.message:
Display latencies of the operations without the wait times.

Neha, Karthik
